info.description:
API request bodies and responses are usually JSON-encoded, except for binary data and some of the OAuth2 endpoints. Note that the `Content-Type` header must be set to `application/json` for this, as the request may otherwise fail with error 400.
When clients have a valid access token, e.g. obtained through the `POST /api/v1/session` or `POST /api/v1/oauth/token` endpoint, they can use a standard Bearer Authorization header to authenticate their requests. Submitting the access token with a custom `X-Auth-Token` header is supported as well.
info.title: PhotoPrism API

get.summary: finds albums and returns them as JSON

post.summary: creates a new album

parameters.description: properties of the album to be created (currently supports Title and Favorite)
parameters.name: album

get.summary: returns album details as JSON

put.summary: updates album metadata like title and description

post.summary: creates a new album containing pictures from other albums

parameters.description: UID of the album to which the pictures are to be added
parameters.name: uid

get.summary: streams the album contents as zip archiv

post.summary: sets the favorite flag for an album

delete.summary: removes the favorite flag from an album

get.summary: returns all share links for the given UID as JSON

post.summary: adds a new album share link and return it as JSON

put.summary: updates an album share link and return it as JSON

parameters.description: properties to be updated (currently supported: slug, expires, token)
parameters.name: link

post.summary: adds photos to an album

get.summary: returns an album cover image

parameters.description: user-specific security token provided with session or 'public' when running PhotoPrism in public mode
parameters.name: token

post.summary: permanently removes multiple albums
deletes multiple labels
approves multiple photos that are currently under review
moves multiple photos to the archive
permanently removes multiple or all photos from the archive
toggles private state of multiple photos
restores multiple photos from the archive

get.summary: returns the client configuration values as JSON
returns backend config options

post.summary: updates backend config options

parameters.description: properties to be updated (only submit values that should be changed)
parameters.name: options

get.summary: returns the raw file data
searches the error logs and returns the results as JSON

delete.summary: removes all entries from the error logs

get.summary: finds and returns faces as JSON
returns a face as JSON
returns file details as JSON

parameters.description: hash (string) SHA-1 hash of the file
parameters.name: hash

get.summary: returns a folder cover image

parameters.description: user-specific security token provided with session or 'public' when running PhotoPrism in public mode
parameters.name: token

get.summary: finds photos and returns results as JSON, so they can be displayed on a map or in a viewer
finds and returns labels as JSON

post.summary: sets favorite flag for a label

delete.summary: removes favorite flag from a label

get.summary: returns a label cover image

parameters.description: user-specific security token provided with session or 'public' when running PhotoPrism in public mode
parameters.name: token

put.summary: updates an existing file area marker to assign faces or other subjects

delete.summary: removes an existing marker subject association

get.summary: returns monthly albums as JSON
finds pictures and returns them as JSON

parameters.description: groups consecutive files that belong to the same photo
parameters.name: merged

get.summary: returns picture details as JSON

put.summary: updates picture details and returns them as JSON

parameters.description: properties to be updated (only submit values that should be changed)
parameters.name: photo

post.summary: marks a photo in review as approved

get.summary: returns the primary file matching that belongs to the photo

put.summary: changes the orientation of a file

post.summary: sets the primary file for a photo
removes a file from an existing photo stack
adds a label to a photo

parameters.description: properties to be updated (currently supports: uncertainty)
parameters.name: label

delete.summary: removes a label from a photo

post.summary: flags a photo as favorite

delete.summary: removes the favorite flags from a photo

get.summary: returns picture details as YAML
finds account settings and returns them as JSON

post.summary: creates a new remote account configuration

parameters.description: properties of the service to be created
parameters.name: service

get.summary: returns an account as JSON

parameters.description: properties to be updated (only submit values that should be changed)
parameters.name: service

get.summary: returns folders that belong to an account as JSON
returns the user app settings as JSON

post.summary: saves the user app settings

get.summary: reports if the server is operational
finds and returns subjects as JSON
returns a subject as JSON

parameters.description: properties to be updated (only submit values that should be changed)
parameters.name: subject

post.summary: flags a subject as favorite

delete.summary: removes the favorite flag from a subject

get.summary: returns a thumbnail image with the requested size

parameters.description: SHA1 file hash, optionally with a crop area suffixed, e.g. '-016014058037'
parameters.name: thumb

parameters.description: user-specific security token provided with session or 'public' when running PhotoPrism in public mode
parameters.name: token

get.summary: returns a video, optionally limited to a byte range for streaming

parameters.description: user-specific security token provided with session
parameters.name: token

post.summary: creates a zip file archive for download

get.summary: downloads a zip file archive

AccShare.description: Manual upload enabled, see SharePath, ShareSize, and ShareExpires.

AccSync.description: Background sync enabled, see SyncDownload and SyncUpload.

AccTimeout.description: Request timeout: default, high, medium, low, none

valid.description: Valid is true if Time is not NULL
